column4: Widws will lock down after unclean shutdown. reboot windows or force it from linux.  restarting windows is a better way
ok, thanks
that is not for you fyi
what does sudo fdisk -l  last letter L show

sudo apt-get install pastebinit  && cp /etc/fstab ~/Desktop/Partition_Layout.txt && sudo fdisk -l >> ~/Desktop/Partition_Layout.txt && lsb_release -a >> ~/Desktop/Partition_Layout.txt && cat /home/$USER/Desktop/Partition_Layout.txt | pastebinit  (Provide Pastebin link in channel)
Device Boot      Start         End      Blocks   Id  System|/dev/sda1               1        9728    78140128+  83  Linux|/dev/sda2   *        9729       19457    78148192+   7  HPFS/NTFS|
so there it shows up
so why is it found by fdisk and not by mount?
one sec
Try a force mount on sda2.. one sec for an example
now I can see it in nautilus
cool
but it is named locked-drive. can I just rename it?
that goes back to an unclean shutdown
renaming doesn't work :(
one sec...
My example gives the drive the name locked-drive, but it isnt locked.  that was just a temp mopunt point we used
mv: cannot move `/media/locked-drive' to `/media/windows': Device or resource busy
wrong..
`/media/locked-drive    are just mount points
so how can I rename it?
log out and back in and see if things are back to normal now that you have forced the mount
